rooms.Name: The old reading room
rooms.Description:
This room was once the room where players and immortals posted notices to
one another.  Now there is only dust and decay.  Broken wood that used to
be desks and benches now lies in heaps upon the floor, and in the center of
the room is a length of sawdust that used to be a bulletin board.  The
remains of the temple lie to the east, and a small glowing chamber lies
to the west.

Exits.Description: Looks like another room with a very important board in it.

rooms.Name: The Shattered Temple
rooms.Description:
This shattered marble pile is all that remains of the once-mighty Temple
of Midgaard.  Before the Immortal's Holocaust, this was the central meeting
place for the Rhovanian community.  Only two walls can be seen partially
standing, as well as one doorway.
 Through that doorway, to the north, is where the temple altar was. To the
east was located the donation room, the west was the temple reading room,
below lay the entrance to the mud school, and south leads to the remains
of the city of Midgaard.  All is quiet and still.

Exits.Description: At the northern end of the temple hall is a statue and a huge altar.

In the east, you see a small alcove with a rickety wooden sign which
reads "Midgaard Donation Room."
You look down the huge stone steps at the temple square below.
You see the Reading Room.
You see the entrance to the old mud school below you.

rooms.Name: Cleric's Inner Sanctum
rooms.Description:
This is the inner sanctum.  You are surprised to see that it doesn't appear 
to have been affected by the war at all.  The picture of Thor still hangs on
the wall, and the altar is still set against the western wall.  You are even
more surprised to see the guildmaster still here looking much as he always
has.  You realize that it must have been the power of his magic that protected
this room from the same fate of the city.  You look at him in awe and realize
that he will never again share his knowledge.

rooms.Name: Old Cleric's Bar
rooms.Description:
This used to be one of the finest members only bars in the city.  Clerics
from all over the land would come here and share tales of their victories and
defeats, while enjoying their favourite drink.  But now all you see is more
of the destruction that has ravaged the rest of the city.  Plunderers have
carried off anything that was not nailed down, and even some that was.  You 
feel sad that you were never able to experience the joys of sitting around
the fire listening to tales of heroics, and feeling safe from the evils of
the land.  To the west you see the clerics inner sanctum, and to the south is
the old entrance hall to the guild.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the waiter:

   Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the waiter.
   List - The waiter will show you all the different drinks and
          specialties, and tell the price of each.

rooms.Name: The entrance to the old Clerics Guild
rooms.Description:
This used to be the entrance hall to the Clerics Guild, small and modest as 
was the nature of the clerics of yore.  The Knight Templar who once protected
this holy place has long since failed his task.  Judging by the huge pile of
skeletons surrounding his corpse he did not fall easily.  You realize that 
this is the first corpse you have seen in all this desolation that is not
rotted beyond all recognition.  You can only assume that the magic of this
place has protected him from the same fate as his foes.  To the north you see
the old clerics bar, and to the west is the ruined temple square.

rooms.Name: The ruined Temple Square
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the ruins of the temple square.  This close to the
temple, it's a wonder the square remains intact at all.  As you gaze upon
the devastation caused by the immortal's negligence, you catch faint
glimpses of skeletal remains of both humans and animals.  The only thing that
looks familiar is the trusty well, still standing in the center of the
square.  Perhaps the water is still safe to drink, but perhaps it isn't...
The old cleric guild lies to the west and the entrance to the remains of the
Grunting Boar Inn is to the east.  What's left of Market Square is south.

rooms.Name: A ragged Entrance Hall
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the open space that once used to be the simple, yet 
functional entrance hall to the Grunting Boar Inn.  The ceiling and most of 
the walls were destroyed during the initial confrontation, and the rest has
slowly deteriorated over the years.  To the north you see some old undelivered
letters and parcels, to the east you see a crookedly leaning bar.

rooms.Name: The old Grunting Boar Inn
rooms.Description:
Ah, what a wonderful place this must hav been.  As you let your gaze wander
about the remains of this tavern, you can almost hear the bawdy laughter and
wonderful music that once must have been heard here.  Unfortunately, all
that now remains is in pieces.  Splintered remains of tables, chairs and
benches lie scattered about the room, as if a brawl had just taken place.
The only piece of intact furniture, standing in front of a broken mirror
and a faded sign is the bar, which leans unsteadily, looking like any
shock would reduce it to the same state as the tables and chairs here.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the Grunting Boar Inn.

   Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the bartender.
   List - The bartender will show you all the different drinks and
          specialties, and tell the price of each.

Although it is very hard to understand, you think it looks a lot like beer,
poems about beer, and small beer-mugs.

rooms.Name: The Reception
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the remains of the Cryogenic Centre Reception area.  All
signs of life have long since disapeared from this once busy place.  An exit
to the north looks cold and uninviting.  The stairs to the south look like 
they can barely hold themselves up, let alone carry your weight.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Rooms are expensive but good!  You may:

   Offer - get an offer on a room - Time is in real life days.
   Rent  - Rent a room (saves your stuff, and quits the game),
           minimum charge is one day.


                          MY WAY OR THE HIGHWAY
                             PAY YOUR RENT!
                WE WON'T THINK TWICE BEFORE KICKING YOU OUT.

rooms.Name: A desolate bakery
rooms.Description:
This room once smelled of fresh bread and pastries, tempting the nostrils
and stomachs of anyone who passed by.  Now only dust fills your senses, and
nothing that will help sustain life is available here.  The remains of
a person you can only assume was the Baker lie here, picked clean by some
animals (you can only assume Fidos).  Sadly, this shoppe is permanently
closed to the public, forever.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Free instructions provided by the store:

   Buy  - Will buy you some bread or pastry.
   List - The baker will kindly tell you the price and sort of the bread in
          his bakery.

You see that this is truly delicious pastry.  Must be made by a Dane from
Denmark (which surely is not the capital of Sweden!).  Former ruler of
Scandinavia, England, Northern Germany, Northern France, Russia, Greenland,
Iceland, Estonia etc.  etc.
   The sight of those large, wholesome chokoladeboller makes your mouth water
and your soul sing.

rooms.Name: The old Grocers Shoppe
rooms.Description:
This was once the general store for Midgaard.  Now, the shelves stand filled
only with dust and cobwebs.  The counter leans crazily as if about to fall,
and a lone skeleton can be seen peeking out from behind the end of the
counter.  There is a faded sign here that looks almost readable...

ExtraDescs.Description:
The sign reads:

  Li t  -  how w ich var ou ite s  r  in  he st r .
  Buy   - B y a  i em.
  V  ue - Th  s opk eper  ill (f ee  f cha ge) te l ho  uch he w ll
          pa  f r y ur it m.
  Sel   - Se l an i em.

rooms.Name: An old Weapons Shoppe
rooms.Description:
This is the remains of the old weapons shoppe.  In addition to the remnants
of the counter and the shelves, several broken blades lie scattered about
here.  You remember how the Shoppe-keeper used to scowl about how some of the
weapons adventurers brought in weren't worth anything.  Here is the proof of
the truth of his statements.  To the south, eastern Main Street can be seen.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The note reads:

  List  - Show which various items are in the store.
  Buy   - Buy an item.
  Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
          pay for your item.
  Sell  - Sell an item.

rooms.Name: The old West Main Street
rooms.Description:
This is the old West Main Street.  Once, the flow of magi that entered both
the now deserted Mage Guild to the south and the ruins to north that used to
be the Magic Shoppe would have interrupted your movement down this street.
Now, however, there is no one here, and no sound except the whistling of the
wind and the occasional barking of a lone fido.  Main Street leads west to
Wall Road and east towards the old Market Square.

rooms.Name: The old West Main Street
rooms.Description:
This is beginning of what was once the western half of the main street
through Midgaard.  To the west the street continues, and to the east the
old market square stands, filled with memories of death.  North is the
old Bakery, and south is the fortified remains of the Armoury.

rooms.Name: A corpse-filled square
rooms.Description:
This square is a scene out of a gothic horror story!  It appear that when
the holocaust hit, most of the citizens of Midgaard were here, hoping to
be saved by their gods, but from the looks of it, none were.  You can
barely crawl through this incidental graveyard, so thick are the skeletons
draped over each other.  This is the most macabre scene you've ever
witnessed.  The remains of the Temple Square lie to the north.  Main street
runs, as ever, east and west and the old Common Square lies to the south.

ExtraDescs.Description: What you see is the Midgaard Worm, stretching around the Palace of Midgaard.

rooms.Name: The old East Main Street
rooms.Description:
You are on the old main street.  It was down this street that one would
travel to get to such places as the Portal to the Comic Realms, the hills
and caves of Moria, the entrance to The Land, the Dwarven Mines, and the
Castle of King Welmar, with his giant chessboard.  Now, however, you doubt
if those places still exits.  The street is lines with various skeletons,
lying in grotesque positions, and you can see doors to the north and south.
Main street continues it's sad journey east, and the old common square is
to the west.

rooms.Name: The old East Main Street
rooms.Description:
This was once the main drag through town for anyone wishing to visit one
of the myriad places east of Midgaard, but now the dust lies heavy and
visable on the street, broken up by only the footprings of Fidos and an
occasional bipedal life form.  The street continues both east and west,
the old Weapons Shoppe lies to the north and the remains of the Warriors
Guild lies to the south.

rooms.Name: The entrance to the old Mage's Guild
rooms.Description:
This entrance hall was dim even before the war, but now it is simply a dark
and broody place.  The walls are scarred with marks of what could only have
been magical fire.  You look at the marks and realize that they are different
from those all over the rest of the city.  Among a huge mound of rotten 
skeletons you find the intact corpse of the sorcerer that once guarded this
guild.  You assume that he fought a great battle defending his guild from
intruders and slew a great many of his foes.  The magic of the guild must have
kept his corpse intact through all these years.  To the north you see the ruins
of the old main street, and to the south you see the old mage's bar.

rooms.Name: A deserted bar
rooms.Description:
The magic that once made this bar a place where mages from all over the land
came to share tales of victory and defeat has faded long ago.  The only thing
that remains is an empty barrel and a few broken chairs.  You think about the
talse of heroics that were once told here by the light of magical fires and
lights and feel suddenly sad.  To the east you see the mage's inner sanctum,
and to the north lies the old entrance to the guild.

Exits.Description: You see the lobby.
You see the laboratory.

rooms.Name: Mage's Laboratory
rooms.Description:
To you surprise this room is much the same as it was in the days before the 
war.  It may be a bit messier, but it doesn't appear to have been affected by
the war the same way the rest of the city was.  It still looks very much like
a place where mages slaved over potions, or created formulas for new, more
powerful spells.  You look around the mess and see lab benches covered with
various beakers, potions, wands and other tools of the mage trade.  There are
still magical symbols covering the floor and some of the walls.  Suddenly you
realize that you are not alone here.  The Master of the Mage's Guild looks at
you with cold eyes, and you think it wise not to bother him by requesting
his teachings.  You realize that his awsome power alone could have kept this
sanctum of mages save throughout the destruction of the city.  To the west is
the old mage's bar.

Exits.Description: You see the bar.

rooms.Name: A fortified Armoury
rooms.Description:
From the looks of this building, the Master Armorer obviously tried to defend
his shop from the mobs who formed as people started dying.  Unfortunately
for him, it doesn't appear as though he was successful.  The building is
still structurally intact, but the interior has been razed.  What little is
left of the counter and shelves is in splinters, and no sign of the Armorer
of any of his steel and bronze wares can be seen.

ExtraDescs.Description:
You can use these commands for trading:

  value <item>     To get the price of an item in your possession.
  sell <item>      To sell something.
  buy <item>       To buy something (provided that the shop has it in store).
  list             Gives you a listing of the shop's inventory.

        WE DON'T GIVE CREDIT; WE DON'T EXPECT TO RECEIVE CREDIT!
                             NO HAGGLING

rooms.Name: The remains of the entrance to the Warriors Guild
rooms.Description:
This used to be the entrance hall to the Guild of Swordsmen.  The roof and
three of the walls were destroyed, but you can see that even before the war
this room was built for funtionality, not comfort.  Looking through the
rotting skeletons in this room you find the corpse of a great knight.  His
body is torn with wounds beyond count.  He must have been a great warrior
indeed to have slain so many of his foes before he himself was overwhelmed by
the sheer numbers of them.  To the north lies the old main street, and to the
east is the bar of swordsmen.

rooms.Name: The old Bar of Swordsmen
rooms.Description:
This once used to be a beautiful bar where all sorts of fighting men came
from all over the land to share tales of heroic deeds and fair maidens in 
distress.   Now the only thing that remains is some broken furniture and a
lot of rubble.  You look at the huge stone fireplace and your heart fills
with despair, knowing that the great warriors who once travelled many miles
to share tales and news of distant lands are no more to protect this once
beautiful city.  To the west is the entrance hall to the guild, and to the
south is the practice yard.

Exits.Description: You see the practice yard.
You see the entrance hall to the thieves guild.

rooms.Name: The Tournament and Practice Yard
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this room your senses are assulted by an overpowering air of
death.  The room is practically covered with dried blood and other unnamable
substances.  Hundreds upon hundreds of rotting skeletons cover the floor.  In
the middle of this mayhem, you see a knight more tall and powerful than any
you have ever seen before.  He is wearing a magnificent suit of armor which is
now dented and scarred in many places and thoroughly covered with blood.  His
hands rest on the hilt of an enormous broadsword covered with intricate
tracery.  He must love the sword more than himself, for it is as spotless as
he is filthy.  You realize that he must have kept this place safe only through
brute force and skill the likes of which only he posesses now.  The only exit
leads back to the bar in the north.

Exits.Description: You see the bar.

rooms.Name: Eastern End of Poor Alley
rooms.Description:
This is the western side of the old Common Square, which lies directly to
the east.  South of here is the first building you've seen with a door still
on it, a place known as the Grubby Inn, and to the north, smelling faintly
of decay, is where the Paladin Guild used to be.  Poor Alley continues west.

Exits.Description: You see the entrance to the Paladins Guild.
South, a door leads into the Grubby Inn.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The sparkling circle seems to be some sort of rift. Trough it you see a 
swirling haze, occasionally parting to reveal a strange and alien landscape 
under a hostile grey sky.  The loud crackling noise that the circle's spark
cause convinces you that trying to squeeze through it could be perilous.

rooms.Name: A dirty square
rooms.Description:
This used to be the common square, where the normal folk of Midgaard would
meet to talk and thieves lay in wait for the unsuspecting.  Now all that
remains are a few skeletons that have spilled over from the north and an
acrid stench wafting from the south where the old city dump used to be.
Poor Alley still extends east and west from here, but what lies down these
once thriving avenues is a mystery.  Whatever it is, it's not human.

rooms.Name: The Dark Alley
rooms.Description:
This is the beginning of what was once known as the Dark Alley.  The rubble
strewn common square is to your west, and the alley continues eastwards.  The
entrance to the old Thieve's Guild is in the south.

ExtraDescs.Description: It is the thieves guild, don't enter if you care about your health or money.

rooms.Name: The ruined entrance hall of the Thieves Guild
rooms.Description:
This used to be a dangerous place for people to come since it was a favourite
hangout of thieves and other people of low morals.  You look around and notice
the corpse of the assassin that once protected his guild from intruders.  The 
huge pile of rotten skeletons surrounding him prove that he at least was loyal
to his guild til the bitter end.  To the north lies the dark alley, and to the
east is the old Thieve's Bar.

rooms.Name: A shattered bar
rooms.Description:
This is the bar where thieves from all over the land once came to brag to 
each other about their latest exploits of theft, deceit and murder while
enjoying a potent firebreather.  You are glad that you were not there to hear
those tales, but at the same time you are saddened that even this part of the
city fell to the war, dismal as it might have been.  To the west you see the
entrance hall to the old guild, and to the south is the yard.

ExtraDescs.Description: As you look at the furniture, the chair you sit on disappears.

rooms.Name: The Secret Yard
rooms.Description:
This is the yard where members of the Thieves Guild came to practice their
skills.  You look around and notice that it looks exactly the same as it did
before the war.  Looking at the guildmaster you figure that the mere sight of
the Thieves Master must have struck terror into any would be scavengers.  The
only exit leads north to the old thieves bar.

rooms.Name: The radioactive waste dump
rooms.Description:
This place was once the dump for the city.  Now, thanks to the ravages of
the immortals and their nuking of anything and everything, it has become a
glowing deathtrap.  Standing here on the edge, the acrid stench has already
begun to burn your nose and throat, and the thought of attempting any
further progress south makes the bile in your throat rise in protest.  The
old common square, and the rest of the ruins of Midgaard lie to the north.

Exits.Description: To the north is the old common square.

rooms.Name: A crumbling Pet Shoppe
rooms.Description:
Once upon a time, this was the Midgaard Pet Shop, where people of all ranks
and levels could aquire a companion.  Now, it just a burnt-out shell of a
building, part of the ruin that is now Midgaard.  There is a peculiar smell
here, though, as if some creature was using this space as a lair....
East Main Street is to the north.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The sign reads:

  Use 'List' to see the available pets.
  Use 'Buy <pet>' to buy yourself a pet.

  Instructions for having pets:

  You can use 'order <pet> <instructions>' to order your pets around.
  If you abuse your pet, it will no longer regard you as its master.
  If you have several pets you may use 'order followers <instructions>'

  You can name the pet you buy as : "buy <pet> <name>"

 Regards,
.
 The Shopkeeper

rooms.Name: Pet Shop Store
rooms.Description:
This  is the small dark room in which the Pet shop keeps his pets.
It is vital that this room's virtual number is exactly one larger
than the Pet Shop number.

rooms.Name: The ruins of the old Magic Shoppe
rooms.Description:
Once this room held magiks galore, powers unimaginable and hopes yet
undreamt of.  Now it holds only death, decay, dust and memories of days
long gone and peoples now extinct.  The shelves which once held potions
and wands are now bare and mostly shattered, and the Arch-Magi who once ran
this store is no where to be seen.  Perhaps he escaped the destruciton of
the city, or perhaps his bones have long since vanished.  No one knows.

rooms.Name: The Bitch and Moan room for the Morts and Immorts.
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the infamous Bitch and Whine room for all those
disgruntled players and immortals.  Every wall is covered with really
sick artwork and colorful phrases about the people on this site.  You
could literally take years trying to read all of the notes that people
have left over the years, but you will have to satisfy yourself with
reading the most current posts (seeing as we hope to have fixed most of
the old prooblems).  Have fun and file a complaint to end your day of
murder and mayhem.

rooms.Name: The old notice room
rooms.Description:
This room is the one place where the radiation seems to have failed to
penetrate.  This room seems clear of dust, and safe from monsters.  There
is a brightly glowing bulletin board here, the only one you've seen yet.
This is the last place that still bears Odin's blessing in this whole
gods-forsaken graveyard of a city.

Exits.Description: To the east lies the ruins of the temple reading room.

rooms.Name: The collapse entrance to the Mud School
rooms.Description:
This used to be the entrance to the newbie school.  Unfortunately, the area
was not strong enough to survive the holocaus brought about by immortal war.
From what you see here, the entire complex must have collapsed in total ruin.
The only exit is back up the way you came.

Exits.Description: Above you lies the remains of the temple.

rooms.Name: Inside the destroyed West Gate of Midgaard
rooms.Description:
This is the western edge of Midgaard.  The gate is missing from the two
gate-towers, and the footbridge that once connected them is gone.  Looking
west, you see an awe-inspiring, terrifying sight:  The entire forest is gone,
and all that can be seen to the west is a glowing, radioactive plain.  The
rocks glow, even in daylight, with a sick, dull reddish light, leaving no
doubt in your mind that to attempt to travel upon them would be lethal.  To
the north is where the old Assassins arena once stood, but that was closed
down even before the holocaust.  Main Street goes east from here, and Wall
Road leads south to the western end of Poor Alley.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.

It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.

Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

rooms.Name: Inside the East Gate of Midgaard
rooms.Description:
You stand before the remains of the east gate.  The two towers what once
supported the gate are in ruins, and the rubble from them, the footbridge
and the gate itself have effectively sealed the city on this side.  To the
south is where Wally's Waterworld once stood, and the ruin to the north
once housed the Midgaard Statistician.

Exits.Description: You see the water shop.
You see Main Street.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.

It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.

rooms.Name: Wall Road
rooms.Description:
As you look around you think about the irony that this road should be called
Wall Road.  Where the wall should have been is now nothing but broken stones
and rubble.  To the north was the west gate of Midgaard, and to the south lies
the beginnings of the old Poor Alley.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

rooms.Name: The southern end of Wall Road
rooms.Description:
This is now the southern end of Wall Road, as well as the western end of
Poor Alley.  South, where the promenade used to be is now nothing but ash.
As you look upon this gray wasteland, a small lizard dashes by you into the
desolation, and immediately sinks out of sight.  You realize that this area
is now a vast wastelands that nothing can survive in...

Exits.Description: You spy a secret door leading out into the wastelands...

ExtraDescs.Description: It says 'Who watches the watchmen?'

It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

rooms.Name: Poor Alley
rooms.Description:
This section of Poor Alley has changed a bit from what you remember.  It
now not only connects the west end with the edge of poor alley, but there
are two houses, north and south, that looks new to you.  They must have
been built before the holocaust, but after you left.

Exits.Description: North lies a shattered home.
South lies a ruined homestead.

rooms.Name: Alley at Levee
rooms.Description:
This alley used to be the bad part of town.  Now the entire town is.  West
the alley continues, running past the old Thieves Guild, east is the end
of the alley in the warehouse district, and south of here is the old levee
access pier where mortals sailed to parts unknown.

rooms.Name: Eastern end of Dark Alley
rooms.Description:
This is the eastern end of the old Dark Alley.  The smell of mold is faint 
but noticable from the remains of Uncle Juan's to the north, and to the south
stands the remains of a harbour warehouse.  The Dark Alley continues west.

rooms.Name: Wall Road
rooms.Description:
You are standing on the road next to the western city wall, which
continues north.  South of here is a bridge across the river.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

rooms.Name: Grubby Inn
rooms.Description:
This inn, the old Grubby Inn, was filthy before the holocaust.  Now, after
unknown years of neglect, it is just this side of hell.  There are smells
here that defy description, and the decor is as awful as ever it was, made
even more so by the half-decayed remains of several fidos that lie scattered
about the area.  This must be home to someone, but you're not sure you
really want to meet whoever this might be.

Exits.Description: To the north is a door, leading to Poor Alley.

rooms.Name: The destroyed Levee pier
rooms.Description:
You stand on the remains of what was once the Levee pier.  The river
beyond once carried adventurous mortals to far distant places with it's clear
waters.  But not anymore.  The water, if you can still call it that, is now
black and brackish, moving more like sludge than water, and as you stand
looking out over it you notice a huge blue sphere shimmering in front
of you.  It seems to be charged with electricity.  For a minute you
think you can make out the form of a naked man crouching inside of
it, but then the vision fades.

rooms.Name: A burnt-out warehouse
rooms.Description:
This was once Midgaard's most popular warehouse, and home to a magical
sailor who, according to legend, had the power to give people a chance to
redeem themselves, to start over and try a different path to fulfillment
and enlightenment.  Alas, such magiks were sumamrily destroyed in the
cataclysm that befell Midgaard, and now this warehouse is desolate.
The eastern end of Poor Alley is to the north.

rooms.Name: On the Bridge
rooms.Description:
You are standing on the stone bridge crosses the river.  The bridge is
built out from the western city wall and the river flows west through an
opening in the wall ten feet below the bridge.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
You cannot really see it from here as it is somewhere beneath your feet.

It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar, just like the wall.

rooms.Name: A shattered private home
rooms.Description:
This was once a private home to a Midgaard-ian family, but is now only a
hovel for fidos and death.  The remains of the family are here, huddled in
the corner, clutching each other in death as they must have in their last
moments of life.  You notice that one skeleton is much smaller than the
others, and you realize, finally, the true extent of the damage the
careless lower immortals wrought upon this city.  There is no excuse.

Exits.Description: South is the old Poor Alley.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.

It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.

rooms.Name: A ruined homestead
rooms.Description:
This former residence of a Midgaard family has been picked clean by the
various scavengers and by the passage of time.  Nothing is left here save
a vew bits of broken wooden furniture and and occasional bone.  Everywhere
you look is desolation and death.  It is not a pretty sight.

Exits.Description: North lies the old Poor Alley.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.

It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.

Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

rooms.Name: The remains of the Temple Altar
rooms.Description:
This was once the main Altar to Odin in the Temple of Midgaard.  Now all
that remains is a heap of slagged stone, a sign of Odin's disfavor upon
the foolish Immortals who brought this destruction down on the helpless
inhabitants of this once proud city.  The only feeling you can sense in
this room is one of profound sadness, as though Odin were weeping.

Exits.Description: To the south, the remains of the temple can be seen.

rooms.Name: Odin's Store
rooms.Description:
This is the small dark room in which Odin keeps the player items that he
takes care of.  It is vital that this room's virtual number is exactly one
larger than the room by the temple altar.

rooms.Name: The remains of Uncle Juan's
rooms.Description:
As you cross the threshold of this tattered building, the smell of mold
assaults your senses.  It appears that Uncle Juan's food out-lasted him, 
from the moldy tacos and nachos sitting around the skeleton you can only
*assume* is what's left of Uncle Juan.  Seems his food lasts a really
long time...  The end of Poor Alley is to the south.

rooms.Name: A dirty marble entrancehall
rooms.Description:
This room, which was once a beautiful marble entranceway to the noble
Paladins Guild, now appears to be a private garbage dump.  Piles of corpses,
all fidos, sit here, and most have been picked clean.  Above you, a
trap door leads to the inner sanctum of the Paladins.  There is no
discernable scent or sound coming from up there, so you have no idea what
to expect should you venture upward.

Exits.Description: You see the eastern end of Poor Alley.
You see the Paladins Bar.

rooms.Name: The remains of Ye Olde Water Shoppe
rooms.Description:
Once upon a time, Wally the Watermaster sold canteens of fresh, clear water
to young adventurers setting off into the world.  Now, all that remains of
his liquid vision is the emblem of a shining canteen that can still be seen
on the front of the delapidated counter.  Everything else has been looted.

rooms.Name: Behind the Temple Altar
rooms.Description:
You are on a dirt path leading away from the Temple Altar which is south
of here.  To the north, the path continues through the lush contryside of
Midgaard.

rooms.Name: The Great Field of Midgaard
rooms.Description:
You are walking on a wide dirt path through the lush, green, fresh
Midgaard countryside.  You can see the horizon to the north, east, and
west. The busy city of Midgaard lies to the south.  All around you
is healthy green grass and an occasional large oak tree.  The sun feels
wonderful on your face and a pleasant wind blows through your hair.
Birds chirp quietly to themselves and you can smell the faint scent of
flowers and freshly cut grass.  You feel like you could lie down in the
grass and stay here forever, surrounded by powerful beauty in all
directions.
The path you are on continues north through the field and south
back to Midgaard, to the east lies a plateau.

Exits.Description: You see more of the path through the Great Field.
You spot a small path that leads off into the woods.
You see the path which goes back to Midgaard.

rooms.Name: The Great Field of Midgaard
rooms.Description:
You are walking on a wide dirt path through the lush, green, fresh
Midgaard countryside.  You can see to the horizon to the north, east, and
west; to busy city of Midgaard lies to the south.  All around you is healthy
green grass and an occasional large oak tree.  The sun feels wonderful on
your face and a pleasant wind blows through your hair.  Birds chirp quietly
to themselves and you can smell the faint scent of flowers and freshly cut
grass.  You feel like you could lie down in the grass and stay here forever,
surrounded by powerful beauty in all directions.
   The path you are on continues north through to a clay road and south
through the Field.

Exits.Description: You see a small clay path.
You see more of the Field.

rooms.Name: A ruined Post Office
rooms.Description:
Smelling of moldy, burnt paper and canvas, the remains of the old Midgaard
Post Office sit in silent effegy to the thousands of mortals who died here.
Appearently, in the final hours, literally hundreds of mail messages were
sent off to other, darker dieties like Charon and Cthulhu.  From the looks
of the remains and decomposed bodies here, it doesn't seem like those
messages were received or, if they were, they weren't acted upon in time.

Exits.Description: South is the where the entrance used to be.  Now it's just rubble.

rooms.Name: The old donation room
rooms.Description:
This was once a place of hope, a place of happiness, a place where those
new to the city could come and receive free gear to help them survive. But
with the irradiation of the city, whatever magics allowed items to be sent
here were destroyed.  Now, the only thing that appears here is dust and
an occasional animal...

Exits.Description: To the west you see the remains of the temple.

rooms.Name: A cold room
rooms.Description:
As you push through a thick curtain, the temperature drops by about 100
degrees!  This room used to the Midgaard Cryo Chamber, but after the attack,
the cryogenic substances leaked out.  Unfortunately for you, the magic that
allowed the chamber to function also seems to have trapped the coldness
here as well.  You wonder what the combination of the cold and the
radiation would do to an animal...

rooms.Name: A run-down bar
rooms.Description:
This, you can only assume, used to be the Paladin's private pub, a place
where the good of spirit and noble of heart could come to relax and share
tales of valor with each other.  From the looks of things, no one has actually
drunk here in quite some time, but someone has been trying deperately to
keep the place clean.  Unfortunately, they haven't been very successful.
Dust sits in piles near the walls, and the carpets bulge suspisciously
around the edges.  The sound of scraping metal is coming from the north.

Exits.Description: You see the Paladins Inner Sanctum.
You see the entrance to the Paladins Guild.

rooms.Name: The Paladins Inner Sanctum
rooms.Description:
This is a small, moderately lit room with very few furnishings.  The walls
are adorned with faded paintings and a huge, pitted holy shield with a large
cross engraved upon it takes up the majority of one wall.  This room is the
cleanest you have encountered yet, but the smell of death is still within it.

Exits.Description: You see the Paladins Bar.

rooms.Name: Old Statistic Shoppe
rooms.Description:
This room is bare, with only a pedastal in the center.  Once this was the
home of the Magikal Statistician, a person was reputed to have the ability
to increase a persons body and mental functions....for a price.  It appears
the sometime after the owner fled, someone tried to turn this into some kind
of temple, but with little success.  It is obvious that no one has been here
for quite some time, according to the dust and lack of footprints.

rooms.Name: The Time Portal
rooms.Description:
As you step through the portal you feel your very essence being torn apart.
You see visions of swirling colors the likes of which are not known to mortal
man.  You slowly feel yourself start to pass out.  You fight the feeling, 
and eventually it passes.  You find yourself back in the time machine where
you started this crazy adventure.  You can't help but wonder if you really
took this journey or if it was all just a crazy dream.  To the north you
see the small inventors shop.

rooms.Name: Inventors Shop
rooms.Description:
You find yourself in a dimly lit room with countless little gadgets and
doohickeys strewn all over shelves, table tops, even the floor.  You try
to make out what some of them are but give up after a short while.  In a back
room you see part of a huge machine that hums quietly.  You look at it and
are suddenly a bit nervous.  Rumor has it that the owner of this shop will
allow people to tour his machine....for a small fee that is.

rooms.Name: The nuclear wastelands
rooms.Description:
All around you there is nothing but desolation.  Rock twisted and
molten into wierd shapes, pools of glass that used to be mountains,
and mountains of slag thrown up by the titanic struggles.  The fould
stench of death hangs in the air.

Exits.Description:
As you look north, you catch a glimpse of the future.  You see
your rotten corpse, forever frozen in glass.
You see more of the nuclear wastelands.
You see more of the nuclear wastelands.
You see more of the nuclear wastelands.

rooms.Name: The nuclear wastelands
rooms.Description:

You see more of the nuclear wastelands.

As you look south, you catch a glimpse of the future.  You see
your rotten corpse, forever frozen in glass.

As you look west, you catch a glimpse of the future.  You see
your rotten corpse, forever frozen in glass.

rooms.Name: The nuclear wastelands
rooms.Description:
You step onto a pool of glass and realize that it hasn't quit
solidified yet.  You start sinking as the heat of the liquid glass
quickly burns your body to cinders.

Exits.Description: You see more of the nuclear wastelands.
You see more of the nuclear wastelands.

As you look south, you catch a glimpse of the future.  You see
your rotten corpse, forever frozen in glass.
You see more of the nuclear wastelands.

You see more of the nuclear wastelands.

As you look west, you catch a glimpse of the future.  You see
your rotten corpse, forever frozen in glass.

rooms.Name: The nuclear wastelands
rooms.Description:
You venture out onto the molten rock and begin to have very
serious doubts as to whether or not you should be here.  You look
around and realize that there will be no one to help you if you
should venture into what is surely a DEATHTRAP.
Then you notice a corpse here, holding a sign for all to see, and
READ!

Exits.Description:
As you look south, you catch a glimpse of the future.  You see 
your rotten corpse, forever frozen in glass.

ExtraDescs.Description:
To the south is a very obvious DEATHTRAP!  If you do not have more
than 400 hitpoints, you WILL die.

rooms.Name: Mouseglove's Lounge
rooms.Description:
Thick with smoke, the smell of beer, and topless waitresses, this place
is the epidome of a "sleazy immort hangout".  There are thick, padded
couches littering the room and several large stuffed chairs as well.  Rumor
has it that the waitresses can be talked into becoming dancers very easily
and for very little money.  They are pretty, the beer is free, all is well!

rooms.Name: Vicious's Bar and Grill
rooms.Description:
You are in the living room of a huge log house.  You inhale the scent
of wood with every breath you take.  The fireplace is roaring, the
lights are dim and there is some wine set in an ice bucket at the side
of a grizzly skin in front of the fire.  You look out of one of the
huge picture windows and see a sight so beautiful it makes your heart
tremble.  For the sun is just setting over a lake, sending a last ray
of light between the mountains, coloring the surface of the lake and
the mountain sides a fiery red.  A solitary loon calls out its 
mournful song.
